reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hintlesham Hall is a very attractive Tudor/Elizabethan/Georgian manor house set in spacious grounds near Ipswich. We stayed on a package deal from offpeakluxury.com, which included dinner and breakfast. Our room was in the annexe, not the main house, and was very big (approx. 18' x 16') with a small hallway and large bathroom. It was very comfortable, with Freeview TV, armchairs and various bits of furniture, but clearly lacked a recent refurb - with rather stained upholstery, worn/grubby carpet in the bathroom. Also the bed was two twins pushed together, leaving an annoying ridge in the middle. The mattresses were pretty firm and not particularly comfortable. The room was very quiet and, with windows on 3 sides, looked out onto some of the well tended gardens which emphasized the country feel.
reviews.title: Grand country house hotel with excellent food and service but rooms a little scruffy.

reviews.text: Hintlesham Hall is heavily used for weddings and other events, but it was curiously quiet during our stay (Easter weekend). Several small golf parties came and went, but the restaurant was never full and the expected wedding on Saturday never materialised.
reviews.title: Stunning country manor house, just a little 'tired'

reviews.text: The highlight of the hotel was the food. Dinner and breakfast is served in the main hall - a very grand room with a stratospheric ceiling, huge chandelier and vast oil paintings. The uneven flagstone floor leading to the hall could well be from the original house, built in the mid 15th century. The food was mostly superb and service exemplary, if occasionally a little overbearing. One minor gripe would be the eagerness of staff to hurry you into the restaurant while enjoying a pre-dinner drink. Menus would appear within minutes of sitting down in the bar and then, without much time to peruse the choices, your orders were requested. We had to keep requesting more time, despite our table being reserved for later. Breakfast is less good than dinner - the full English has clearly been sitting around for a while, waiting to be plated - but is generous and extremely filling. The wine list is fairly extensive and not too expensive (from £25 upwards) considering the choice. We had excellent wines each evening - once on recommendation from the head waiter.
reviews.title: A Super Seventy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The fitness centre is very good and free to use for all hotel guests - a well equipped gym, aerobics room with punch bag and weights, a heated outdoor swimming pool and masseurs available (at extra cost).
reviews.title: Once again Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right next door is the Hintlesham Hall Golf Club - a 'championship course' of approx 6,500 yards. It is run separately from the hotel, but is discounted for hotel guests. We played 9 holes at twilight, though the club tried to charge us the full rate (soon rectified by the consistently excellent hotel reception staff). The course is very well maintained and is nicely varied. We had it more or less to ourselves (teeing off at 4.40pm). The club house is very nice with an outdoor terrace and large bar.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms and the whole ambience of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hintlesham last weekend and i was a bit worried given some of the negative feedback on here but overall we had a really nice time. We got a good rate from a website which included dinner (& breakfast). Food wise the hotel is excellent dinner was a lovely experience and Breakfast was great too. We also had lunch which wasn't included and i found it reasonably priced and enjoyable. The hotel rooms/ corridors might be a bit "tired" but there is nothing wrong with them and they are really big (i saw two rooms). The dining/ lounge areas are gorgeous from an "old English house" perspective. Staff were helpful and friendly. For some reason the main bar didn't seem to be permanently staffed but there was always someone closeby to either take an order or get the right person. This hotel is not 5 star luxury but it makes for a really nice weekend somewhere a bit "grand"- in my opinion.
reviews.title: Really Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From start to finish nothing was too much trouble!
reviews.title: A Truly Relaxing Stay
Very Disappointing
reviews.text: We had a spacious room and the bathroom had been recently refurbished to a high standard. The shower was Huge and there was a rolltop bath in the main bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our stay was dinner in the parlour, a very intimate dining room with lovely wood panelled walls. Service was excellent and the wine list was extensive and surprisingly modestly priced.
reviews.title: Going Downhill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a function in the hotel but we were notified of this when booking and we were not affected by this at all (we had chosen a room that was not in the main building - Gallery).
reviews.title: Not sure who this hotel is for.............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WOW !! What a fabulous experience ! From the warmest of welcomes, right through superb cuisine and fine wines in luxurious surroundings, then a clever, funny, thought-provoking Murder Mystery evening, professional friendly staff and the most delightful ambience - we came away wanting to return again and again to Hintlesham Hall. Nothing was too much trouble. We felt so welcome and spoilt. What a fabulous way to spend our time. We were shown round this historic and beautiful Tudor Manor House and its magnificent grounds - WOW !! Steeped in the most romantic historical period yet up-to-the-minute amenities for one's convenience and enjoyment. We have found our haven and it is right on our doorstep in the rolling Suffolk countryside.
reviews.title: A Haven on our Doorstep ....

likes.liked: — Luxurious, comfortable, individual, everything catered for.....
likes.disliked: — The fact we couldn't stay and enjoy it for longer !!

reviews.title: Luxury Stay
reviews.text: Sun 9 March 2008 /Mon 10 March 2008

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister and I stay at Hintlesham Hall every year and we have some wonderful memories from each of our visits.
reviews.title: Dissapointing return...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As always, we were given a very warm welcome at Reception and all the staff were professional, courteous and friendly at all times.
reviews.title: Tinctured with the Perfection of English Hospitality

likes.disliked: — Gym not attached to the hotel

reviews.title: Christmas Like It Should Be
reviews.text: On this occasion, we stayed in a room called "The Gallery" which was wonderful. Our en-suite bathroom was of the highest standard with it's huge walk in shower, beautiful marble floor etc., and there was also a 'free-standing' bath in the gallery area which meant you could indulge yourself in a hot, foaming bath whilst watching tv /or you could sip a glass of champagne whilst losing yourself in a book - perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed in in England and we have been in several over the years!!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entrance to the hotel is very majestic and the hotel looks outstanding in its grounds.
reviews.title: Realy nice but abit stuffy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome as soon as we arrived was superb and all the staff were attentive and friendly.
reviews.title: Absolute heaven!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we were not in the main house, our room was massive and we had several sofas and chairs to choose from to relax in our room after the drive. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but when this was mentioned in passing at the reception, they advised would get everything sent to the room which was all there on our return
reviews.title: Great value mid-week break

likes.liked: — The peaceful ambience ... and the upgrade!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is full of character , beautiful rooms and many stunning paintings, the only down side was a very wet day but no log fires!!!!!
reviews.title: An absolute jewel

likes.liked: — The ambience of a country house hotel
